title: What is the use of Ethernet port? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ethernet ports are used on switches. Actually your router is a switch that allows it to communicate with the other devices connected. The ports play a important role as they allow only the designated device to see that data instead of everyone that is connected to the switch. A switches port saves the devices MAC address so that when it receives data only meant for a certain address, it can send it down the port matching the correct MAC address. This way no other device sees the data unlike what happens with a hub, which broadcasts any data it receives to every device connected.

Ethernet Protocol is a networking protocol many are familiar with at the layer 2 or hardware layer as an interface between a network and the computer you are wanting to interface with. Its common physical interface is a RJ-45 (Registered Jack from Ma Bell days) datajack and dataplug as a 8 wire interface. It has many uses as the dataplug locks into its dataport with a clip on one side of the plug. In Professional Audio/video world, it is used on Range Extenders as a technology to extended the range of a video signal such as HDMI beyond the typical 50 feet. It is also the most ubiquitous networking protocol and has it used as a Networking protocol interface.
